reviewText: I am very familiar with the Cuban national Ballet’s version and the virtuosos of the 3rd Act so I have to get use to this performance which is much mellower.I found outstanding the performance of Svetlana Zakharova in the roll of Odette/Odile and Antonino Sutera as the jester, but Roberto Bolle was not very convincing as prince Siegfried, in my opinion he was cold.The Ballet Company is outstanding. Beautiful choreography and costumes, good lighting.It is one of my favorite’s ballets and this is all in all a very lovely version.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Finally, there is a production of Swan Lake that doesn't absolutely depress me or put me to sleep, if you can imagine such a thing.  Unlike La Scala's production of Giselle, the orchestral score is outstanding and if you are a Maxwell Parrish fan, as I am, the sets take one back to a time of mythical bliss.  Quite frankly, this production fits the story line of Swan Lake as I have always imagined it should be in my head.  I have seen Fonteyne's and Makharova's performances and Baryshnikov's choreography and all three left me numb . . . in fact, I couldn't finish watching any to the end (we were live for Baryshnikov's premiere).  I am not normally a Zakharova fan but she hit the part right on, and I still say that Roberto Bolle is underestimated for his technical skill.  What a thrill and delight to see these two performing together, plus the corps de ballet were near perfection.  Now, I can enjoy watching this over and over again.  And I must confess--for those who have read my other critiques--the camera person has not been at fault on my recently acquired DVDs for cutting off the footwork of the danseurs; my remote control had reset my plasma screen for zoom viewing without my knowing.  Now, I have had the satisfaction of going back and watching the performances of La Scala's Giselle and Bolshoi's The Pharoah's Daughter again without the stress of having the critical footwork chopped off at the bottom of my screen.
summary: My Most Enjoyable Swan Lake So Far
Title: N/A

reviewText: not enough swans, only zaharova worth watching, russian ballet head and shoulders above this performance.kirov and bolshoi rule. music not at all exciting and opening appearance of the swans only 16 plus 3 plus 4 an economy version if ever i saw one, only iceland ballet as bad

reviewText: This is the most phenominal performance of Swan Lake I have ever seen. Svetlana Zakharova has everything required of a great prima ballarina. Her fluid arm movment, incredible extension, limber form are all wedded to the most expressive performance of Odille I know. The pas de deux in act 2 is langorously performed. Miss Zakharova tantilizes the audience with exquisitely lyrical movement all in the service of the character. She is ably partnered by Roberto Bolle who is himself extraordinary.  What is especially appealing about this performance is its staging conceived with TV and DVD in mind. The costumes, the court coreography are wonderful. Antonino Sutara as the Jester is worthy of praise as are the quartet and trio of swans. If you have only one performance of Swan Lake let this be it.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I watched this and the American Ballet Theatre production back to back. This Odette/Odile doesn't begin to compare to Jillian Murphy, except that she's prettier; she seems lethargic throughout, except when she does her famous spins (whatever they're called). And yes, Jillian's arms and legs are lither and more swanlike, whatever they say about this gal's limberness. The rest of the cast are even worse. The sets and costumes look left over from the Bolshoi of twenty years ago. Others have already commented on the lousy camera work (Why do they give the disc five stars when it's so badly filmed???) Especially annoying is the jester. This kind of character adds to a ballet only when he/she (one really can't tell in this case what it is) is an exceptionally talented performer. He/she in this production is definitely not. Just ordinary and in the way a lot. Both he/she and the prince are in the way during the ballroom scene when the other dancers are performing. And the corps de ballet in the ABT production is amazing--the most coordinated I've ever seen. Skip this one; get that one.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Zakharova dazzles with her technique and unique style. A true ambassador of the Bolshoi's contemporary dancers in the 21st century.
